com.sun.tools.visualvm.jmx
Class JmxApplicationsSupport

java.lang.Object
  com.sun.tools.visualvm.jmx.JmxApplicationsSupport

public final class JmxApplicationsSupport
extends Object

Support for creating JMX applications in VisualVM.

Since:
VisualVM 1.1
Author:
Jiri Sedlacek

Method Detail

getInstance

public static JmxApplicationsSupport getInstance()
Returns singleton instance of JmxApplicationsSupport.

Returns:
singleton instance of JmxApplicationsSupport.

createJmxApplication

public Application createJmxApplication(String connectionString,
                                        String displayName,
                                        String username,
                                        String password)
                                 throws JmxApplicationException
Creates new Application defined by JMX connection and adds it to the Applications tree. The application won't be restored on another VisualVM sessions. Throws a JmxApplicationException if the application cannot be created. Note that even though the created application won't be restored for another VisualVM sessions, the host created for this application will be restored.

Parameters:
connectionString - definition of the connection, for example hostname:port
displayName - display name for the application, may be null
username - username for the connection, may be null
password - password for the connection, may be null
Returns:
created JMX application
Throws:
JmxApplicationException - if creating the application failed

createJmxApplication

public Application createJmxApplication(String connectionString,
                                        String displayName,
                                        String username,
                                        String password,
                                        boolean saveCredentials,
                                        boolean persistent)
                                 throws JmxApplicationException
Creates new Application defined by JMX connection and adds it to the Applications tree. Throws a JmxApplicationException if the application cannot be created. Note that even if the created application isn't persistent for another VisualVM sessions, the host created for this application will be restored.

Parameters:
connectionString - definition of the connection, for example hostname:port
displayName - display name for the application, may be null
username - username for the connection, may be null
password - password for the connection, may be null
saveCredentials - if persistent, controls whether the username and password should be persisted for another VisualVM sessions
persistent - controls whether the application definition will be persisted for another VisualVM sessions
Returns:
created JMX application
Throws:
JmxApplicationException - if creating the application failed

createJmxApplication

public Application createJmxApplication(String connectionString,
                                        String displayName,
                                        EnvironmentProvider provider,
                                        boolean persistent)
                                 throws JmxApplicationException
Creates new Application defined by JMX connection and adds it to the Applications tree. Throws a JmxApplicationException if the application cannot be created.

Parameters:
connectionString - definition of the connection, for example hostname:port
displayName - display name for the application, may be null
provider - JMX EnvironmentProvider for the Application
persistent - controls whether the application definition will be persisted for another VisualVM sessions
Returns:
created JMX application
Throws:
JmxApplicationException - if creating the application failed
Since:
VisualVM 1.2

createJmxApplicationInteractive

public Application createJmxApplicationInteractive(String connectionString,
                                                   String displayName,
                                                   String username,
                                                   String password)
Creates new Application defined by JMX connection and adds it to the Applications tree. The application won't be restored on another VisualVM sessions. Displays progress during application creation and opens an error dialog if creating the application failed. Throws a JmxApplicationException if the application cannot be created. Note that even though the created application won't be restored for another VisualVM sessions, the host created for this application will be restored.

Parameters:
connectionString - definition of the connection, for example hostname:port
displayName - display name for the application, may be null
username - username for the connection, may be null
password - password for the connection, may be null
Returns:
created JMX application or null if creating the application failed
Throws:
JmxApplicationException - if creating the application failed

createJmxApplicationInteractive

public Application createJmxApplicationInteractive(String connectionString,
                                                   String displayName,
                                                   String username,
                                                   String password,
                                                   boolean saveCredentials,
                                                   boolean persistent)
Creates new Application defined by JMX connection and adds it to the Applications tree. Displays progress during application creation and opens an error dialog if creating the application failed. Note that even if the created application isn't persistent for another VisualVM sessions, the host created for this application will be restored.

Parameters:
connectionString - definition of the connection, for example hostname:port
displayName - display name for the application, may be null
username - username for the connection, may be null
password - password for the connection, may be null
saveCredentials - if persistent, controls whether the username and password should be persisted for another VisualVM sessions
persistent - controls whether the application definition will be persisted for another VisualVM sessions
Returns:
created JMX application or null if creating the application failed

createJmxApplicationInteractive

public Application createJmxApplicationInteractive(String connectionString,
                                                   String displayName,
                                                   EnvironmentProvider provider,
                                                   boolean persistent)
Creates new Application defined by JMX connection and adds it to the Applications tree. Displays progress during application creation and opens an error dialog if creating the application failed. Note that even if the created application isn't persistent for another VisualVM sessions, the host created for this application will be restored.

Parameters:
connectionString - definition of the connection, for example hostname:port
displayName - display name for the application, may be null
provider - JMX EnvironmentProvider for the Application
persistent - controls whether the application definition will be persisted for another VisualVM sessions
Returns:
created JMX application or null if creating the application failed
Since:
VisualVM 1.2

getStorageDirectory

public static File getStorageDirectory()
Returns storage directory for defined JMX applications.

Returns:
storage directory for defined JMX applications.

storageDirectoryExists

public static boolean storageDirectoryExists()
Returns true if the storage directory for defined JMX applications already exists, false otherwise.

Returns:
true if the storage directory for defined JMX applications already exists, false otherwise.
